# MeasurementFormatter

**Class**

A formatter that provides localized representations of units and measurements.

## Declaration

```swift
class MeasurementFormatter
```

## Overview

You use the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/MeasurementFormatter/string(from:)-wt9y] method to create a localized representation of an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/NSMeasurement] object, and you use the [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/MeasurementFormatter/string(from:)-4hwjz] method to create a localized representation of an [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/Unit] object. The formatter takes into account the specified [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/MeasurementFormatter/locale], [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/MeasurementFormatter/unitStyle], and [doc://com.apple.foundation/documentation/Foundation/MeasurementFormatter/unitOptions-swift.property] when producing string representations of units and measurements.



## Specifying the Format

- **unitOptions**: The options for how the unit is formatted.
- **MeasurementFormatter.UnitOptions**: Measurement formatter options.
- **unitStyle**: The unit style.
- **locale**: The locale of the formatter.
- **numberFormatter**: The number formatter used to format the quantity of a measurement.

## Converting Measurements

- **string(from:)**: Creates and returns a localized string representation of the provided measurement.
- **string(from:)**: Creates and returns a localized string representation of the provided measurement.
- **string(from:)**: Creates and returns a localized string representation of the provided unit of measure.
